page.title: 12HOUSING in Withington page 2
page.content: including 8{Airey war houses (prefabricated dwellings for the rapid housing of people after the 1939_45 war, which were intended to last for about 20 years) A few of the houses now have{owner occupiers,}since the Council made them available for purchase by their tenants. Further development is strictly controlled by the Green Belt policy, and by the University of Manchester who have influence in{planning {control,}in order to restrict radio interference with their telescopes at {Jodrell Bank.}There have been about nine houses or bungalows built in the last 20 years, all for reasons connected with work or business.
